H0.text: On 31 May 2010, the President of which country announced his resignation after local politicians criticised comments he made in relation to overseas military deployments. Kyrgyzstan

H1.text: On 31 May 2010, the President of which country announced his resignation after local politicians criticised comments he made in relation to overseas military deployments. Poland

H2.text: On 31 May 2010, the President of which country announced his resignation after local politicians criticised comments he made in relation to overseas military deployments. Afghanistan

H3.text: On 31 May 2010, the President of which country announced his resignation after local politicians criticised comments he made in relation to overseas military deployments. Nimska

A4.text: On 15 April 2010, at 19:00, Bakiyev left Kyrgyzstan for Kazakhstan, having signed a resignation letter.

A5.text: The head of the new provisional government, Roza Otunbayeva, declared that Bakiyev had not resigned and was trying to rally support.

A6.text: Kyrgyz President Replaces Renegade Regional Governor

A7.text: In October 2020, President Sooronbay Jeenbekov resigned after protests caused by irregularities in parliamentary elections on 4 October 2020.

A8.text: President Bakiyev, together with his relatives, including his son Maksim and brother Janishâ€”were forced to flee to Kazakhstan and then sought asylum in Belarus.

A9.text: President Kurmanbek Bakiyev reportedly flees the country on April 7, 2010, as the government steps down and protestors overrun the parliament building.

A10.text: President Kurmanbek Bakiyev escapes Bishkek, purportedly to a southern region of the country through Osh.

A11.text: large riots in April 2010 forced him to resign and flee the country
